message_1:
In a time series analysis, the monthly sales of a company for the past 12 months were recorded as follows:
10,000  11,000  15,000  14,000  12,000  16,000  13,000  17,000  19,000  18,000  20,000  22,000
Find the three-month moving average of the sales for the months of August, September, and October.
message_2:
To find the three-month moving average for the months of August, September, and October, we need to first identify the sales data for these months. In the given data, August corresponds to the 8th month, September to the 9th month, and October to the 10th month. So, the sales data for these months are:

August: 17,000
September: 19,000
October: 18,000

Now, we will calculate the moving average for these three months:

Three-month moving average for August = (Sales of June + Sales of July + Sales of August) / 3
= (12,000 + 16,000 + 17,000) / 3
= 45,000 / 3
= 15,000

Three-month moving average for September = (Sales of July + Sales of August + Sales of September) / 3
= (16,000 + 17,000 + 19,000) / 3
= 52,000 / 3
= 17,333.33 (rounded to two decimal places)

Three-month moving average for October = (Sales of August + Sales of September + Sales of October) / 3
= (17,000 + 19,000 + 18,000) / 3
= 54,000 / 3
= 18,000

So, the three-month moving averages for August, September, and October are 15,000, 17,333.33, and 18,000, respectively.
